pullRequest.title: Add records to planned test cases
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
This patch rearranges the planned test cases, and adds input/output records into the persisted
test spec. spec.json is now split into plan.json and spec.json. plan.json contains the query plan
and configs. spec.json contains everything else. This split ensures that we serialize the plan
using the exact same ObjectMapper as a real KSQL node. The spec.json needs a specially configured
ObjectMapper to serialize RecordNode correctly (deal with null keys and decimals)
To review, look through the first commit. The second is just the generated changes.

commit.message:
refactor: rearrange the planned test cases and add records

This patch rearranges the planned test cases, and adds input/output records into the persisted
test spec. spec.json is now split into plan.json and spec.json. plan.json contains the query plan
and configs. spec.json contains everything else. This split ensures that we serialize the plan
using the exact same ObjectMapper as a real KSQL node. The spec.json needs a specially configured
ObjectMapper to serialize RecordNode correctly (deal with null keys and decimals)

nodes.bodyText:
nit:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  final List<KsqlPlan> planNode,
          
          
            
                  final List<KsqlPlan> planNodes,
I'd inline all of these accessors that access either planNode or specNode. Calls can just use getPlanNode().getPlan() etc.

nit: commented out code.
If these can be null I'd recommend making them Optional.  (You can plug Java8 support into Jackson if the mapper you're using doesn't have this already).
Plus, i'd recommend taking an immutable copy of the input.

out of interest, why do we include the configs?  do we include the configs in the details persisted to the command topic too?
Wondering, as I thought the plan contained all the information needed to build the query, so the config seems superfluous.
